Section.name: Language
Section.helptext: Select this option to change the language.

Section.name: Setup_Browser_Selection
Section.helptext: Select which setup browser to use: GUI or Text. Auto mode uses text when the user enters RBSU via serial console, and uses GUI via IRC or physical terminal.

Section.name: Workload_Profile
Section.helptext: Select this option to choose a workload profile for power and performance.

Section.name: Dynamic_Power_Capping_Functionality
Section.helptext: Use this option to configure when the System ROM executes power calibration during the boot process.

Section.name: Extended_Memory_Test
Section.helptext: When enabled, the system validates memory during the memory initialization process.

Section.name: Memory_Fast_Training
Section.helptext: This option allows for a boot time reduction by controlling when the BIOS bypasses a full memory training.

Section.name: UEFI_POST_Discovery_Mode
Section.helptext: Use this option to configure the UEFI POST Discovery Mode.

Section.name: Memory_Clear_on_Warm_Reset
Section.helptext: Use this option to configure when memory is cleared on warm resets.

Section.name: Embedded_Serial_Port
Section.helptext: Select this option to assign the logical COM Port address and associated default resources to the selected physical serial port. The operating system can overwrite this setting.

Section.name: Virtual_Serial_Port
Section.helptext: Use this option to assign the logical COM port address and associated default resources used by the Virtual Serial Port (VSP).

Section.name: BIOS_Serial_Console_Port
Section.helptext: Use this option to re-direct video and keystrokes through the serial port to OS boot.

Section.name: BIOS_Serial_Console_Emulation_Mode
Section.helptext: Use this option to select the emulation mode type.

Section.name: BIOS_Serial_Console_Baud_Rate
Section.helptext: This is the transfer rate at which data is transmitted through the serial port.

Section.name: EMS_Console
Section.helptext: Use this option to configure the ACPI serial port settings, which include the ability to redirect the Windows Server Emergency Management console (EMS) through either the physical or virtual serial port.

Section.name: USB_Control
Section.helptext: Select which USB port are enabled.

Section.name: USB_Boot_Support
Section.helptext: Set this option to disabled to prevent the system from booting to any USB devices connected to the server.

Section.name: Removable_Flash_Media_Boot_Sequence
Section.helptext: For Legacy Boot Mode Only. Use this option to select which USB or SD Card devices you want to search for first when enumerating boot devices.

Section.name: Virtual_Install_Disk
Section.helptext: Use this option to control the Virtual Install Disk. The Virtual Install Disk contains drivers specific to this server that an OS can use during installation.

Section.name: Internal_SD_Card_Slot
Section.helptext: Use this option to enable or disable the Internal SD Card Slot. When set to disabled, the SD card slot is disabled, regardless of whether an SD Card is installed or not.

Section.name: ASR_Status
Section.helptext: Use this option to configure the Automatic Server Recovery option, which enables the system to automatically reboot if the server locks up.

Section.name: ASR_Timeout
Section.helptext: When Automatic Server Recovery is enabled, you can use this option to set the time to wait before rebooting the server in the event of an operating system crash or server lockup.

Section.name: Wake-On_LAN
Section.helptext: You can configure the server to be powered on remotely when it receives a special packet.

Section.name: POST_F1_Prompt
Section.helptext: Use this option to configure the system to display the F1 key in the server POST screen.

Section.name: Power_Button_Mode
Section.helptext: Disabling this option disables the momentary power button functionality.

Section.name: Automatic_Power-On
Section.helptext: Use this option to configure the server to automatically power on when AC power is applied to the system.

Section.name: Power-On_Delay
Section.helptext: Use this option to delay the server from turning on for a specified time.

Section.name: Server_Name
Section.helptext: Select this option to modify the server name text line.

Section.name: Server_Primary_OS
Section.helptext: Use this option to modify the Server Primary OS text line.

Section.name: Server_Other_Information
Section.helptext: Use this option to modify the Other Server text line.

Section.name: Administrator_Name
Section.helptext: Enter the server administrator's name text.

Section.name: Administrator_Phone_Number
Section.helptext: Enter the server administrator's phone number text.

Section.name: Administrator_E-mail_Address
Section.helptext: Enter the server administrator's e-mail address.

Section.name: Administrator_Other_Information
Section.helptext: Enter the server administrator's information text.

Section.name: Service_Contact_Name
Section.helptext: Enter the server service contact name text.

Section.name: Service_Contact_Phone_Number
Section.helptext: Enter the server service contact phone number text.

Section.name: Service_Contact_E-mail_Address
Section.helptext: Enter the server service contact e-mail address.

Section.name: Service_Contact_Other_Information
Section.helptext: Enter the other server service contact information text.

Section.name: Custom_POST_Message
Section.helptext: Enter a message to be displayed during system startup.

Section.name: Embedded_Diagnostics
Section.helptext: Use this option to enable or disable Embedded Diagnostics functionality.

Section.name: Embedded_Diagnostics_Mode
Section.helptext: Use this option to configure Embedded Diagnostics in Auto or Text Console mode.

Section.name: Intel_Hyper-Threading
Section.helptext: Use this option to enable or disable Intel Hyper-Threading. When enabled, each physical processor core operates as two logical processor cores.

Section.name: Enabled_Cores_per_Processor
Section.helptext: This option allows limiting the number of enabled processor cores per physical processor. 00 = Enable All Cores.

Section.name: Processor_x2APIC_Support
Section.helptext: x2APIC support enables operating systems to run more efficiently on high core count configurations. It also optimized interrupt distribution in virtualized environments.

Section.name: Intel_TXT_Support
Section.helptext: Use this option to modify Intel TXT support.

Section.name: Advanced_Memory_Protection
Section.helptext: Use this option to configure additional memory protection with ECC (Error Checking and Correcting). Options and support vary per system.

Section.name: Memory_Refresh_Rate
Section.helptext: This option controls the refresh rate of the memory controller and might affect the performance and resiliency of the server memory.

Section.name: Channel_Interleaving
Section.helptext: You can only configure this option if the Workload Profile is set to Custom. Use this option to modify the level of interleaving for which the memory system is configured.

Section.name: Maximum_Memory_Bus_Frequency
Section.helptext: Use this option to configure the memory system to run memory at a lower maximum speed than that supported by the installed processor and DIMM configuration.

Section.name: Memory_Patrol_Scrubbing
Section.helptext: This option corrects memory soft errors so that, over the length of the system runtime, the risk of producing multi-bit and uncorrectable errors is reduced.

Section.name: Node_Interleaving
Section.helptext: Use this option to disable the NUMA architecture properties for the system.

Section.name: Memory_Mirroring_Mode
Section.helptext: Use this option to configure various Memory Mirroring modes.

Section.name: Memory_Remap
Section.helptext: Use this option to remap memory that may have been previously disabled from the system due to a failure event, such as an uncorrectable memory error.

Section.name: NVDIMM-N_Support
Section.helptext: This option controls whether NVDIMM-N support (including backing up the contents of the memory to flash on power down/reset) is enabled.

Section.name: NVDIMM-N_Interleaving
Section.helptext: This option controls whether the NVDIMMs of type NVDIMM-N installed on a particular processor will be interleaved with each other in the memory map.

Section.name: NVDIMM-N_ACPI_Objects
Section.helptext: When enabled, the Microsoft specific NVDIMM-N ACPI device objects will be generated.

Section.name: Persistent_Memory_Backup_Power_Policy
Section.helptext: This option controls whether the system will wait during system boot for batteries to charge if sufficient battery backup power for the installed persistent memory is not available.

Section.name: Persistent_Memory_Integrity_Check
Section.helptext: When this option is enabled, persistent memory will be checked during system boot to determine data integrity.

Section.name: Persistent_Memory_Address_Range_Scrub
Section.helptext: Use this option to configure the NVDIMM memory Address Range Scrub support.

Section.name: Intel_VT
Section.helptext: When enabled, a hypervisor or operating system supporting this option can use hardware capabilities provided by Intel VT.

Section.name: Intel_VT-d
Section.helptext: If enabled, a hypervisor or operating system supporting this option can use hardware capabilities provided by Intel VT for Directed I/O.

Section.name: SR-IOV
Section.helptext: If enabled, SR-IOV support enables a hypervisor to create virtual instances of a PCI-express device, potentially increasing performance.

Section.name: Boot_Mode
Section.helptext: Use this option to select the boot mode of the system.

Section.name: UEFI_Optimized_Boot
Section.helptext: Set this option to disabled for compatibility with Microsoft Windows 2008 and Windows 2008 R2 operating systems on a system configured for UEFI Boot Mode.

Section.name: Boot_Order_Policy
Section.helptext: Use this option to configure how the system attempts to boot devices per the Boot Order when no bootable device is found.

Section.name: Legacy_Boot_Order
Section.helptext: Legacy Boot Order. Current Initial ProgramLoad (IPL) device boot order.

Conrep.Section: 00 03 02 04 05 ff ff ff ff ff ff ff ff ff ff ff

Section.name: Legacy_Boot_Order_Size
Section.helptext: Legacy Boot Order Size. Current Initial ProgramLoad (IPL) device boot order size.

Section.name: Legacy_Boot_Controller_Order
Section.helptext: Lists the current legacy boot controller ordering.

Section.name: Pre-Boot_Network_Environment
Section.helptext: Use this option to set the preference for Pre-Boot Network.

Section.name: IPv6_DHCP_Unique_Identifier
Section.helptext: Use this option to control the IPv6 DHCP Unique Identifier (DUID).

Section.name: Network_Boot_Retry_Support
Section.helptext: Use this option to configure the Network Boot Retry Support.

Section.name: Network_Boot_Retry_Count
Section.helptext: Use this option to control the number of times a network device is attempted for boot.

Section.name: UEFI_HTTP_Boot
Section.helptext: Use this option to control the UEFI HTTP Boot support.

Section.name: UEFI_iSCSI_Boot_Policy
Section.helptext: Use this option to set the iSCSI Boot Policy.

Section.name: Embedded_Network_Boot
Section.helptext: Raw data bytes that include data for disabling network boot for embedded NIC ports. One byte per port. 01=Enabled. 00=Disabled.

Section.name: PCIe_Slot_Network_Boot
Section.helptext: Raw data bytes that include data for disabling network boot for UEFI PCIe NIC Slots/Ports. Two bytes per slot. One bit per port. 1=Enabled. 0=Disabled. 01 00 = Slot 1 Port 1 Enabled.

Section.name: Pre-Boot_Network_Interface
Section.helptext: Raw data bytes for selecting which NIC/Port is used for the Pre-Boot Network. First byte, second byte is reserved. 00 - Auto.

Section.name: Pre-Boot_Network_Proxy
Section.helptext: Use this option to configure pre-boot network proxy.

Section.name: Pre-Boot_DHCPv4
Section.helptext: When enabled, this option enables obtaining the pre-boot network IPv4 configuration from a DHCP server.

Section.name: Pre-Boot_IPv4_Address
Section.helptext: Use this option to specify the pre-boot network IPv4 address.

Section.name: Pre-Boot_IPv4_Subnet_Mask
Section.helptext: Use this option to specify the pre-boot network subnet mask.

Section.name: Pre-Boot_IPv4_Gateway
Section.helptext: Use this option to specify the pre-boot network gateway IPv4 address.

Section.name: Pre-Boot_IPv4_Primary_DNS
Section.helptext: Use this option to specify the pre-boot network Primary DNS Server IPv4 address.

Section.name: Pre-Boot_IPv4_Secondary_DNS
Section.helptext: Use this option to specify the pre-boot network Secondary DNS Server IPv4 address.

Section.name: Pre-Boot_IPv6_Config_Policy
Section.helptext: When set to Automatic, this option enables obtaining the pre-boot network IPv6 configuration automatically.

Section.name: Pre-Boot_IPv6_Address
Section.helptext: Use this option to specify the pre-boot network IPv6 address.

Section.name: Pre-Boot_IPv6_Gateway
Section.helptext: Use this option to specify the pre-boot network gateway IPv6 address.

Section.name: Pre-Boot_IPv6_Primary_DNS
Section.helptext: Use this option to specify the pre-boot network Primary DNS Server IPv6 address.

Section.name: Pre-Boot_IPv6_Secondary_DNS
Section.helptext: Use this option to specify the pre-boot network Secondary DNS Server IPv6 address.

Section.name: Pre-Boot_Boot_from_URL_1
Section.helptext: Use this option to configure a network URL to a bootable ISO or EFI file.

Section.name: Pre-Boot_Boot_from_URL_2
Section.helptext: Use this option to configure a network URL to a bootable ISO or EFI file.

Section.name: Pre-Boot_Boot_from_URL_3
Section.helptext: Use this option to configure a network URL to a bootable ISO or EFI file.

Section.name: Pre-Boot_Boot_from_URL_4
Section.helptext: Use this option to configure a network URL to a bootable ISO or EFI file.

Section.name: VLAN_Settings
Section.helptext: Setting the VLAN Control(01=Enabled), VLAN ID, and VLAN Priority.

Section.name: Fibre_Channel/FCoE_Scan_Policy
Section.helptext: Use this option to change the default Fibre Channel or FCoE policy for scanning for boot targets.

Section.name: Embedded_SATA_Configuration
Section.helptext: Use this option to configure the embedded chipset SATA controller for AHCI or RAID modes.

Section.name: SATA_Secure_Erase
Section.helptext: Use this option to control whether Secure Erase functionality is supported.

Section.name: Embedded_Storage_Boot_Policy
Section.helptext: Raw data bytes for setting the Embedded Storage Boot Policy. 00 = Boot all targets. FF = Boot no targets. 03 = Boot a maximum of three targets.

Section.name: PCIe_Slot_Storage_Boot_Policy
Section.helptext: Raw data bytes for setting the PCIe Slot Storage Boot Policy. 00 = Boot all targets. FF = Boot no targets. 03 = Boot a maximum of three targets.

Section.name: Embedded_NVM_Express_Option_ROM
Section.helptext: Use this option to enable or disable embedded NVM Express Option ROM.

Section.name: Power_Regulator
Section.helptext: Use this option to configure the following Power Regulator support.

Section.name: Minimum_Processor_Idle_Power_Core_C-State
Section.helptext: Use this option to select the lowest idle power state (C-state) of the processor that the operating system uses.

Section.name: Minimum_Processor_Idle_Power_Package_C-State
Section.helptext: Use this option to select the lowest idle package power state (C-state) of the processor.

Section.name: Intel_Turbo_Boost_Technology
Section.helptext: Turbo Boost Technology enables the processor to transition to a higher frequency than the processor's rated speed if the processor has available power and is within temperature specifications.

Section.name: Energy/Performance_Bias
Section.helptext: Use this option to configure several processor subsystems to optimize the performance and power usage of the processor.

Section.name: Collaborative_Power_Control
Section.helptext: For OSes that support the Processor Clocking Control Interface, enabling this option allows the OS to request processor frequency changes even when the server has the Power Regulator option configured for Dynamic Power Savings Mode.

Section.name: Intel_DMI_Link_Frequency
Section.helptext: Use this option to force the link speed between the processor and the southbridge to run at slower speeds to save power.

Section.name: NUMA_Group_Size_Optimization
Section.helptext: Use this option to configure how the System ROM reports the size of a NUMA node (number of logical processors), which assists the Operating System in grouping processors for application use (referred to as Kgroups).

Section.name: Intel_Performance_Monitoring_Support
Section.helptext: This option does not impact performance. When enabled, this option exposes certain chipset devices that can be used with the Intel Performance Monitoring Toolkit.

Section.name: Uncore_Frequency_Scaling
Section.helptext: This option controls the frequency scaling of the processor's internal busses (the uncore).

Section.name: Sub-NUMA_Clustering
Section.helptext: When enabled, Sub-NUMA Clustering divides the processor's cores, cache, and memory into multiple NUMA domains. Enabling this feature can increase performance for workloads that are NUMA aware and optimized.

Section.name: Energy_Efficient_Turbo
Section.helptext: This option controls whether the processor uses an energy efficiency based policy when engaging turbo range frequencies. This option is only applicable when Turbo Mode is enabled.

Section.name: Local/Remote_Threshold
Section.helptext: Local/Remote Threshold setting.

Section.name: LLC_Dead_Line_Allocation
Section.helptext: Enabled - Opportunistically fill dead lines in LLC. Disabled - Never fill dead lines in LLC.

Section.name: Stale_A_to_S
Section.helptext: Stale A to S directory optimization.

Section.name: HW_Prefetcher
Section.helptext: Use this option to disable the processor HW prefetch feature.

Section.name: Adjacent_Sector_Prefetch
Section.helptext: Use this option to disable the processor Adjacent Sector Prefetch feature.

Section.name: DCU_Stream_Prefetcher
Section.helptext: Use this option to disable the processor DCU Stream Prefetcher feature.

Section.name: DCU_IP_Prefetcher
Section.helptext: Use this option to disable the processor DCU IP Prefetcher feature.

Section.name: LLC_Prefetch
Section.helptext: Use this option to configure the processor Last Level Cache (LLC) prefetch feature.

Section.name: XPT_Prefetcher
Section.helptext: Use this option to disable the processor XPT Prefetch feature. In some cases, setting this option to disabled can improve performance.

Section.name: ACPI_SLIT
Section.helptext: The ACPI SLIT (System Locality Information Table) defines the relative access times between processors, memory subsystems, and I/O subsystems.

Section.name: Intel_NIC_DMA_Channels_(IOAT)
Section.helptext: Use this option to select the Intel NIC DMA Channels support. This is a NIC acceleration option that runs only on Intel-based NICs.

Section.name: Memory_Proximity_Reporting_for_I/O
Section.helptext: When enabled, the System ROM reports the proximity relationship between I/O devices and system memory to the operating system.

Section.name: Intel_UPI_Link_Enablement
Section.helptext: Use this option to configure the UPI topology to use fewer links between processors, when available.

Section.name: Intel_UPI_Link_Power_Management
Section.helptext: Use this option to place the Ultra Path Interconnect (UPI) links into a low power state when the links are not being used.

Section.name: Intel_UPI_Link_Frequency
Section.helptext: Use this option to set the UPI Link frequency to a lower speed. Running at a lower frequency can reduce power consumption, but can also affect system performance.

Section.name: UPI_Prefetcher
Section.helptext: Use this option to disable the processor UPI Prefetch feature. In some cases, setting this option to disabled can improve performance.

Section.name: Processor_Jitter_Control
Section.helptext: Processor Jitter Control allows the customer to manage processor frequency variance due to technologies such as Turbo which vary the frequency based on power, thermals, and active cores..

Section.name: Core_Boosting
Section.helptext: Use this option to enable the Core Boosting technology to increase processor performance on qualified processors.

Section.name: Redundant_Power_Supply_Mode
Section.helptext: Use this option to configure how the system handles redundant power supply configurations.

Section.name: Embedded_UEFI_Shell
Section.helptext: Use this option to enable or disable the Embedded UEFI Shell.

Section.name: Add_Embedded_UEFI_Shell_to_Boot_Order
Section.helptext: When enabled, this option adds the Embedded UEFI Shell as an entry in the UEFI Boot Order list.

Section.name: UEFI_Shell_Script_Auto-Start
Section.helptext: Use this option to enable or disable automatic execution of the default startup script for the Embedded UEFI Shell.

Section.name: Shell_Script_Verification
Section.helptext: Enable this option to allow verification of UEFI shell script files, if Secure Boot is enabled.

Section.name: Shell_Auto-Start_Script_Location
Section.helptext: Use this option to select the location of the Embedded UEFI Shell startup script.

Section.name: Discover_Shell_Auto-Start_Script_using_DHCP
Section.helptext: Use this option to let the Shell discover its startup script URL using DHCP.

Section.name: Network_Location_for_Shell_Auto-Start_Script
Section.helptext: Use this option to configure a network URL to a UEFI Shell startup script.

Section.name: One-Time_Boot_Menu_(F11 Prompt)
Section.helptext: Use this option to disable the POST One-Time Boot F11 Prompt.

Section.name: Intelligent_Provisioning_(F10 Prompt)
Section.helptext: Use this option to enable or disable the Intelligent Provisioning functionality.

Section.name: System_Intrusion_Detection
Section.helptext: Enabled/Disabled System Intrusion Detection.

Section.name: Processor_AES-NI_Support
Section.helptext: Use this option to enable or disable the Advanced Encryption Standard Instruction Set (AES-NI) in the processor.

Section.name: Backup_ROM_Image_Authentication
Section.helptext: Use this option to enable crypticgraphic authentication of the backup ROM image on startup.

Section.name: TPM_12_Operation
Section.helptext: Use this option to enable, disable, or clear the Trusted Platform Module and BIOS secure startup.

Section.name: TPM_20_Operation
Section.helptext: Use this option to perform a clear operation on the TPM.

Section.name: TPM_Visibility
Section.helptext: Use this option to hide TPM from the operating system. When the TPM is hidden, BIOS secure startup is disabled, and the TPM does not respond to any commands.

Section.name: TPM_UEFI_Option_ROM_Measurement
Section.helptext: Use this option to enable measuring the UEFI PCI option ROMs. Disabling this option skips measuring the UEFI PCI option ROMs.

Section.name: NVMe_PCIe_Resource_Padding
Section.helptext: Use this option to configure PCIe resources to support PCIe hot-add for NVMe drives.

Section.name: Maximum_PCI_Express_Speed
Section.helptext: This option enables you to lower the maximum PCI Express speed at which the server allows PCI Express devices to operate.

Section.name: PCIe_Device_Disable_Embedded_Mezz
Section.helptext: Raw data bytes that include data for disabling PCIe devices. Embedded and Blade Mezzanine card are included in this section. Different bit for each device. 0=Enabled. 1=Disabled.

Section.name: PCIe_Device_Disable_SATA_Slots
Section.helptext: Raw data bytes that include data for disabling PCIe devices. SATA Controllers and PCIe Slots are included in this section. Different bit for each device. 0=Enabled. 1=Disabled.

Section.name: ROM_Selection
Section.helptext: Use this option to revert the server to a previous BIOS ROM image.

Section.name: Embedded_Video_Connection
Section.helptext: When configured for Auto mode, the external video connection to the embedded video controller is automatically disabled to save power when a monitor is not attached.

Section.name: Consistent_Device_Naming
Section.helptext: Use this option to select the level of Consistent Device Naming.

Section.name: Mixed_Power_Supply_Reporting
Section.helptext: When enabled, the server logs a message that a mixed power supply configuration is present.

Section.name: High_Precision_Event_Timer_(HPET)_ACPI_Support
Section.helptext: Use this option to disable the High Precision Event Timer (HPET) table and device object in ACPI.

Section.name: Power_Supply_Requirements
Section.helptext: Use this option to configure the power supply redundancy logic.

Section.name: Thermal_Configuration
Section.helptext: Use this option to select the fan cooling solution for the system.

Section.name: Thermal_Shutdown
Section.helptext: Use this option to control the reaction of the system to caution level thermal events.

Section.name: Fan_Installation_Requirements
Section.helptext: Use this option to configure how the server reacts when all required fans are not installed.

Section.name: Fan_Failure_Policy
Section.helptext: Use this option to configure how the server reacts when fans fail resulting in the server not having required fans in operation.

Section.name: Extended_Ambient_Temperature_Support
Section.helptext: Use this option to enable the server to operate at higher ambient temperatures than normally supported.

Section.name: UEFI_Serial_Debug_Message_Level
Section.helptext: Use this option to enable UEFI Serial Debug output and verbosity level.

Section.name: POST_Verbose_Boot_Progress
Section.helptext: Use this option to enable verbose boot progress messaging.

Section.name: Time_Format
Section.helptext: This option controls how the system time is stored in the hardware Real Time Clock (RTC).

Section.name: Time_Zone
Section.helptext: Display the currently selected time zone. Please refer the help doc for all the possible time zones.

Section.name: Asset_Tag_UEFI
Section.helptext: For UEFI systems only. Asset tag string, up to 32 characters.

Section.name: Asset_Tag_Protection_UEFI
Section.helptext: For UEFI systems only. When set to Locked, the Asset tag will not be erased if default system settings are restored.
